We examine the behavior of \\( z(t) \\) under the effects of an integral transform \\( T(z) = \\int_0^t e^{At}z(s) ds \\), where \\( A \\) is a complex number.

If \\( T(z) \\) is applied to a function \\( z(t) \\) from t = 0 to T, will the resulting function at time T be holomorphic if \\( z(t) \\) is holomorphic for all t in [0, T]?
Explanation: The transformation \\( T(z) \\) involves integration with the exponentiation of a complex matrix, which affects the holomorphic property of \\( z(t) \\). The integral could potentially influence both the real and imaginary components in a way that violates the Cauchy-Riemann conditions at some point in the interval.
